history.proof: intros H_ev H_ex. destruct H_ex as [l H_is_lim]. exists l. apply is_lim_seq_ext_loc with (u := u) (v := v). - apply H_ev. - apply H_is_lim.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
v: nat -> R
u: nat -> R

Goal:
eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_LimInf_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq v l
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_LimSup_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq v l
LimInf_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimInf_seq u) (LimInf_seq v)
LimSup_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimSup_seq u) (LimSup_seq v)
ex_lim_LimSup_LimInf_seq : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u < -> LimSup_seq u = LimInf_seq u
is_lim_seq' = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, eventually (fun n : nat => Rabs (u n - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => M < u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n < M) end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
LimSup_seq_opp : forall u : nat -> R, LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) = Rbar_opp (LimInf_seq u)
is_LimSup_opp_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) (Rbar_opp l) < -> is_LimInf_seq u l
filterlim_bounded : forall a : nat -> ?V, (exists x : ?V, filterlim a eventually (locally x)) -> {M : R | forall n : nat, norm (a n) <= M} where ?K : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- AbsRing] ?V : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- NormedModule ?K]
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
filterlim_ext_loc : forall f g : ?T -> ?U, ?F (fun x : ?T => f x = g x) -> filterlim f ?F ?G -> filterlim g ?F ?G where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- Filter ?F]
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
LPO_ub_dec : forall u : nat -> R, {M : R | forall n : nat, u n <= M} + {forall M : R, exists n : nat, M < u n}
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
filterlim_locally : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (y : ?U), filterlim f ?F (locally y) < -> (forall eps : posreal, ?F (fun x : ?T => ball y eps (f x))) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- UniformSpace] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R |- Filter ?F]
is_lim_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => filterlim u eventually (Rbar_locally l) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ <= n)%nat) => conj (HP...
Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
is_LimSup_LimInf_lim_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_lim_seq u l
LimInf_seq = fun u : nat -> R => proj1_sig (ex_LimInf_seq u) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]

```coq
intros H_ev H_ex.
destruct H_ex as [l H_is_lim].
exists l.
apply is_lim_seq_ext_loc with (u := u) (v := v).
- exact H_ev.
- exact H_is_lim.
Qed.
```

original: intros H_ev H_ex. destruct H_ex as [l H_is_lim]. exists l. apply is_lim_seq_ext_loc with (u := u) (v := v). - apply H_ev. - apply H_is_lim.
